citations.narrative:
Several sections of the perimeter fence were noted to have wire sagging and separated from the fence posts due to the
presence of overgrown vegetation, thus leaving these sections with a height below the 8 feet required for some of the
species housed at this facility. Perimeter fences below the required height may allow access to the facility by other
animals and unauthorized persons. Perimeter fences should protect the animals at the facility by restricting other animals
and unauthorized persons from accessing the facility, and function as a secondary containment system. The facility must
ensure that the perimeter fence is kept in good repair and maintains security.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 23, 2025, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
Several sections of the perimeter fence were noted to have wire sagging and separated from the fence posts due to the 
presence of overgrown vegetation, thus leaving these sections with a height below the 8 feet required for some of the 
species housed at this facility. Perimeter fences below the required height may allow access to the facility by other 
animals and unauthorized persons. Perimeter fences should protect the animals at the facility by restricting other animals 
and unauthorized persons from accessing the facility, and function as a secondary containment system. The facility must 
ensure that the perimeter fence is kept in good repair and maintains security. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by June 23, 2025, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
